lines.text: THE TOBACCO INSIITUTE
1S7S1S:RAPT. NORTHWEST
MARVIN A. KASTENEYUML. PS. D.
SRC OO NOLONDISVW
Dcregtog or Statistice
March 2, 1981
Dr. Takeshi Hirayama
Chief, Epidemiology Division
National' Cancer Centre Research
Institute
1-l Tsukiji,5-Chome, Chuo-ku
Tokyo, 104 Japan
Dear Dr. Hirayama:
I have read' with interest your British Medical Journal
paper on lung cancer and nonsmoking wives. Fron a statistical
point of view your article raises several questions whose answers
are neccssary for my seientifie undcrstanding of your findings.
I would appreciate your response to the following requests:
Your paper deals with the same study population of
265,li8 persons you have reported on during the past
fifteen years. When and where were all the demographic
and iifestyle data, such as smoking and oecupation
histories, recorded? Who gathered these data and
what type of training did they have? Please furnish a
copy of'the questionnaire that was used. It would also
be extremely helpful to me if you would send a copy of
the data file - preferably in computer-readable form.
I would be willing to pay the necessary expenses.
One of your groups of husbands ineluded both nonsmokers
and occasional smokers. How is an occasional smoker
defined? How many occasional smokers are in this group?
Why were these two classes combined? Another group of
husbands consisted of ex-smokers and smokers of i9'or
fewer cigarettes daily. How many ex-smokers were included
in this group? Why were these two classes combined?
Did you measure the times, if any, that the nonsmoking
wives were present when their husbands snoked? If yes,
how was this done?
u.
Is the mortality information you have reporied based
on death certificates? If not, from what sources did
you obtain this information? If so, how have you
assessed the reliability of these records? How do you
reconcile your use of these records with Japanese studies
reported in ig77 by Hiyoshi and others in the Journal of
the National Cancer Institute, and in 1975 by the Radiation
Effects Research Foundation on the accuracy of cancer
diagnoses?
